benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Trigger a payment (authorization, purchase or credit)

covered: POST Method - Valid Payload: Scenarios TC01 and TC02 demonstrate successful creation with valid payloads and required fields
POST Method - Invalid Payload: Scenarios TC09 and TC21 demonstrate handling of malformed and malicious inputs
POST Method - Large Payloads: Scenario TC05 tests system behavior with large payloads
POST Method - Validation: Scenarios TC16 TC18 TC19 TC15 cover minimum/maximum values, missing optional fields, unsupported currency and extra parameters
Server Error Handling: Scenarios TC12 TC13 TC14 TC23 cover gateway failures, unknown statuses, timeouts and degraded dependencies
Authorization: Scenarios TC06 and TC20 cover missing header and unauthorized access; authenticated scenarios exist
Query Parameters: Scenarios TC01 and TC03 verify usage of paymentMethodId and multiple plugin properties
Concurrent Requests: Scenario TC22 validates handling of concurrent submissions and avoiding duplicates
Backward Compatibility and Regression: Scenarios TC24 and TC25 cover payment method selection and older API version compatibility
Performance Testing: Scenarios TC26 and TC27 assess response times under normal and peak load
Resource Utilization: Scenario TC28 checks resource usage under high load
Accessibility: Scenarios TC29 and TC30 ensure documentation and error messages are accessible
Security and Validation: Scenario TC21 includes input validation against security threats, plus general validation coverage via other tests
Partial Input and Missing Optional Fields: Scenario TC18 covers missing optional fields already included in Validation
Unknown Account and Invalid Account Handling: Scenarios TC07 TC08 confirm invalid format and non existent accounts
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No test for idempotent handling or duplicate POSTs
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or rate limiting on POST
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag or Cache-Control headers in responses
Internal Server Error: No explicit test simulating 500 due to DB or internal failure
Unauthorized token edge cases: Only missing token tested; no tests for expired/invalid token scenarios
Pagination: Not applicable for POST; but not tested for related resources vs accounts
recommendations: Add tests for idempotency to cover duplicate submissions (eg, idempotency keys)
Add rate limiting / throttling tests to validate behavior under bursts (e.g., 429 responses)
Add explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (DB or internal service failures)
Add caching behavior tests (ETag/Cache-Control headers) where applicable
Extend authorization tests to cover expired or invalid tokens beyond missing header
Consider adding tests for additional edge currency formats and broader parameter combinations
